result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Anthony Jackson Jr

records.addlTxt:
Clerk contacted the parties via email regarding Scheduling Conference.
Next Court date: Scheduling Conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant John Anthony Jackson Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Megan Kaldunski appeared by video for John Anthony Jackson Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective A. Harris. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  seeing discovery on this case.  (John A. Jackson, Jr. - #2022009262, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion for Dismissal - Untimely Appointed Counsel.  (John A. Jackson, Jr. - #2022009262, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant John Anthony Jackson Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Megan Kaldunski in court for John Anthony Jackson Jr.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for an Order to Show Cause hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Public Defender's Office has appointed Attorney Megan Kaldunski. Court reinstated Time Limits. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Received and Filed.
Attorney Megan Kaldunski.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence on the Grounds Due to Defect of Defendant's Miranda Rights.  (John A. Jackson, Jr. - #2022009262, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defense contacted the Court and State via email regarding Order to Show Cause hearing. Defense is not available September 29, 2022 and requested a new date.

Order to Show Cause hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 1:30pm in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant John Anthony Jackson Jr in Court with Attorney Thomas Holland Reed on behalf of the Public Defender's Office. Defendant John Anthony Jackson Jr in custody.  Attorney William T. Berens on behalf of Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Public Defender's Office has NOT been able to appoint counsel for Defendant. Court TOLLED TIME LIMITS. Court ordered case adjourned for Order to Show Cause hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office. If counsel has not been appointed by the next date, Court will appoint counsel at county expense. Order to Show Cause hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received and filed.
Defendant's Motion for Dismissal.  (John A. Jackson, Jr - #2022009262, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion for Untimely Appointed Counsel.  (John A. Jackson - #2022009262, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence.  (John A. Jackson - #2022009262, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant John Anthony Jackson Jr not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant's Motion for Speedy Trial.  (John A. Jackson, Jr. - #2022009262, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
EXPIRES NOVEMBER 28, 2022 (however, Defendant has not had a Preliminary hearing).

Defendant John Anthony Jackson not in court, defendant in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness was present. Case adjourned due to SPD not appointing counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered an oral no contact order with K.R. and D.R.H.
State is to submit a written no contact order at the next court date.

Defendant John Anthony Jackson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant John Anthony Jackson in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
